greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The Riordan square of the Fine numbers, triangle read by rows, T(n, k) for 0 <= k<= n.
comment: Fine numbers as defined in A000957 have a(0) = 0 whereas our variant has a(0) = 1. The rows sums of the triangle are |A002420|.
maple: # The function RiordanSquare is defined in A321620.
mathematica: (* The function RiordanSquare is defined in A321620. *)
xref: T(n, 0) = A000957 (Fine), |A002420| (row sums), A000007 (alternating row sums).
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Nov 22 2018
